item.title: As Trump's VP List Narrows, One Woman Remains---and She's a Long Shot
item.description: Elise Stefanik is thought to be a lower-tier contender to Marco Rubio, Doug Burgum and J.D. Vance.

item.title: Supreme Court Set to Decide Trump's Bid for Immunity
item.description: Monday’s expected ruling, before the court’s summer break, could add more drama to presidential race.

item.title: Steve Bannon Is Heading to Prison. He'll Still Have Influence in Trump World.
item.description: As he prepares to serve a contempt-of-Congress sentence, the former White House aide embraces his image as a “dangerous” voice.

item.title: The Sad Inevitability of Biden's Reckoning
item.description: Democrats are paying the price for overriding voter concerns about the president’s age, Molly Ball writes.

item.title: French Markets, Euro Rally After First Round of Elections
item.description: French stock markets, government bonds and the euro rallied on expectations of a French cross-party alliance to deny the far-right an overall majority in the second round of the elections.

item.title: Gold Futures Fall But Remain Rangebound on Lack of Drivers
item.description: Gold futures edged lower, having traded in a narrow range for weeks on a lack of stimulus but going forward, investors will look for data that points to U.S. stagflation, which will be supportive for the precious metal, MKS PAMP said.

item.title: UK Election Is Likely to Have Little Impact on Sterling
item.description: The July 4 U.K. general election may have little impact on sterling as the opposition Labour Party is widely expected to secure a majority, ING said.

item.title: Trump's Top Fan in Europe Grasps a Political Megaphone With EU Presidency
item.description: The anti-immigration Hungarian leader Viktor Orban takes his turn in the bloc’s rotating presidency under the motto “Make Europe Great Again.”

item.title: Trading in French Bonds Could Be Choppy Ahead of Second Election Round
item.description: The 10-year French government bond yield spread over German peers narrowed but price action in French bonds will likely be choppy until the next election round on Sunday, Mizuho said.

item.title: Oil Prices Rise as Traders Continue to Bet on Market Tightening
item.description: Oil prices rose as expectations for a tighter market continued to pull in speculative money, with the latest trader data showing the net long increased over the last week, ING said.

item.title: France's CAC-40 Expected to Open Sharply Higher After Elections
item.description: France’s CAC-40 is expected to open around 2.7% higher, according to IG, due to expectations that the far-right won’t secure an overall majority after Sunday’s first-round elections.

item.title: Atos Strikes Agreement on Financial Rescue Terms
item.description: Atos said it reached an agreement with a group of banks and bondholders on the terms of its financial restructuring as the struggling French IT firm seeks to shore up its coffers.

item.title: Rising Government Debt Threatens Financial Stability, Inflation, BIS Says
item.description: Governments should cut back on borrowing to ease one of the biggest threats to the stability of the global financial system and support efforts to tame inflation, the Bank for International Settlements said.

item.title: BlackRock to Acquire Data Provider Preqin for $3.22 Billion
item.description: The deal is part of the efforts by the world’s largest asset manager to bolster data capabilities as it expands into private-market investments.

item.title: Boeing Scoops Up Spirit AeroSystems, Its Troubled 737 Supplier
item.description: Deal will combine the factories that build 737 MAX jets in a bid to fix quality issues.

item.title: Tech Industry Wants to Lock Up Nuclear Power for AI
item.description: The largest tech companies are looking to buy nuclear power directly from plants, which could meet their huge needs but sap the grid of critical resources.

item.title: Flurry of Flutters Sparks Scandal in British Election
item.description: Even in a nation that wagers on everything from royal babies to snail races, the small bets by politicians on the coming vote are perturbing the public.

item.title: For Ukraine and Russia, a Deadly Summer Lies Ahead With Little Hope of Big Gains
item.description: Thousands are likely to die as Moscow and Kyiv’s warring forces search for openings along a front line that is largely static.

item.title: No Nvidia in Your Portfolio? 'You're Just Toast'
item.description: In this year’s bull market, there are artificial-intelligence plays like Nvidia—and then there’s everything else.

item.title: Cambodia Denies Hosting Chinese Naval Base, But Two Ships Raise Suspicions
item.description: Residents of a Cambodian coastal village say they have been warned not to talk about the expansion taking place at the nearby naval base or the two Chinese warships docked there.
